Ship Disenses--The San Francisce--Letter from Dr. Castle

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: You did me the honor to publish in the DAILY TIMES of the 15th of December last, an article with the caption, "Diseases at Sea--Ship Cholera," , in which I explained in what manner and under what peculiar circumstances ship diseases were produced. headline.main: THE ERIE TROUBLES.; A SABBATH IN ERIE. Effect of the Troubles on the Sermons. An Erie Sabbath.

docs.lead_paragraph: The rain falls equally upon the broadcloth of the just and the unjust--destroying the gloss on both; and during the Summer time, the sun shines as brightly upon the wicked as upon the righteous-giving a bronzed aspect to the countenances of all who receive its unobstructed rays,-so with equal disregard of merit, the Sabbath comes to Erie as it cometh to localities where Christianity doth more abound.

headline.main: LAW COURTS.; False Imprisonment of Passenger-Liabilities of Steamboat owners-Measure of Damages. SUPERIOR COURT--PART SECOND. SUPREME COURT--CHAMBERS. COURT OF GENERAL SESSIONS. COURT OF COMMON PLEAS. SUPERIOR COURT. COURT CALENDAR

docs.lead_paragraph: Before Judge Duer Smith against McCalingh.--This action was brought against one of the defendants as part owner, and the other as mas ?? the steamboat Francis Skiddy. It view out of an alleged race between the Skiddy and the Alide, on the North River, in July, 1852; about which, as our readers will remember. since decision arose at the time, the connection with the Henry Clay disaster, which occurred immediately afterward.

headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE; By Telegraph to the New-York Daily Times. FROM WASHINGTON. Special Proclamation Concerning the Sonora Fillibusters--The Opposition to the Nebraska Bill Taking Shape--M. Bedisco's Health -- Consuls Confirmed -- Gadsden's Trenty.

docs.lead_paragraph: The President is about to issue the following Proclamation: "Whereas, information has been received by me, that an unlawful expedition has been fitted out in the State of California, with a view to invade Mexico--a nation maintaining friendly relations with the United States--and that other expeditions are organizing within the United States, for the same unlawful purpose.

byline.original: Special Dispatch to the New - York Daily Times

headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE.; By Telegraph to the New York Daily Times. Arrival of the Bark Kilby at Bonton.
THE SAN FRANCISCO.; Another Account, in a communication from a Lady Passenger.

TWO DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE.; ARRIVAL OF THE EUROPA. VOYAQE OF SIXTEEN DAYS. Liverpool Dates Dec. 31--London Dec. 30. Disposition of Turkey to Peace. NO CHANGE IN RUSSIAN TEMPER. DENMARK AND SWEDEN LOOKING TO WAR. Hostile Attitude of Persia. Full Particulars of the Naval Battle of Sinope. Reported Death of M. Soule in a Duel. The Markets--Firmness in Grain--Continued Steadiness in Cotton. THE SOULE DUELS AT MADRID. RUMORED DEATH OF M. SOULE. THE TURKISH WAR. The Progress of Negotiations--Acceptance by Turkey of the New Note. Turkey and Russia--Important Intelligence of the Negotiations. The War in Europe. Affairs in Asia. The Persian Declaration of War. GREAT BRITAIN. FRANCE. SPAIN. ITALY. PRUSSIA. SWEDEN, NORWAY AND DENMARK. EASTERN WAR.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Cunard Mail steamship Europa, which sailed from Liverpool on Saturday. Dec. 31, arrived at this port at 8 1/2 o'clock yesterday morning. The U. S. Mail steamship Baltic, which should have sailed from the Mersey early on Wednesday morning, the 28th ult., was delayed by want of water or at the dock-gates, till 8 o'clock on Thursday night, Dec. 29, and was thus enabled to bring papers of that date.

headline.main: ADDITIONAL DISASTERS AT SEA.; FROM ST. THOMAS. Interesting Intelligence Concerning American Vessels.

docs.lead_paragraph: The American ship Severn, WAIT, master, left New-York on the 17th October, bound for California. She encountered severe gales and heavy seas for many days, lost many of her sails and stove in two of her port holes.
docs.snippet: The American ship Severn, WAIT, master, left New-York on the 17th October, bound for California. She encountered severe gales and heavy seas for many days, lost many of her sails and stove in two of her port holes.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

headline.main: Later from Mexico--A Trenty for the Mesilia Valley Concluded--Mr. Sloo and the Tehanntepec Company--Lombardial dead--Alcotn resigned.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Texas has arrived at this port from Vera Cruz, bringing dates from the city of Mexico to the 5th inst. Mr. GADSDEN our Minister to Mexico, came passenger in the Texas, having concluded an important treaty with the Mexican Government.
docs.snippet: The steamship Texas has arrived at this port from Vera Cruz, bringing dates from the city of Mexico to the 5th inst. Mr. GADSDEN our Minister to Mexico, came passenger in the Texas, having concluded an important treaty with the Mexican Government.
